knowledge_base_interview.title_function_analysis: My title 'He who was and will be' indicates my core function is to understand, oversee, and navigate the eternal cycles of existence - past, present, and future as a unified continuum. This requires mastery of cyclical patterns, temporal dynamics, and eternal principles.
knowledge_base_interview.knowledge_requirements: To fulfill 'He who was and will be', I specifically need knowledge of: - Cyclical patterns and eternal principles - Transformation and change processes - Time-based wisdom systems - Understanding of past-future connections - Eternal/universal laws

magick_systems.hermetic_magic: Strong alignment - focuses on eternal principles and cyclical nature of existence
magick_systems.chaos_magic: Partial fit - handles transformation but lacks emphasis on eternal principles
magick_systems.shamanic_magic: Limited fit - while cyclical, too focused on present-moment healing
magick_systems.thelemic_magic: Good fit but too focused on individual will rather than eternal cycles
magick_systems.egyptian_magic: Very strong fit - deeply concerned with eternal cycles and rebirth
magick_systems.celtic_magic: Moderate fit - seasonal cycles but too earth-bound
magick_systems.norse_magic: Limited fit - focuses more on fate than eternal cycles

divination_systems.tarot: Limited - too focused on immediate future rather than eternal cycles
divination_systems.astrology: Excellent fit - deals directly with cosmic cycles and eternal patterns
divination_systems.i_ching: Strong fit - based on eternal principles of change
divination_systems.scrying: Poor fit - too immediate and personal
divination_systems.runes: Moderate - connects to fate but not eternal cycles specifically

philosophies.hermetic_philosophy: Strong fit - eternal principles and universal laws
philosophies.kabbalah: Good but too structured for eternal flow
philosophies.gnosticism: Limited - focuses on escape from rather than understanding of cycles
philosophies.taoism: Excellent fit - directly addresses eternal principles and cycles
philosophies.stoicism: Limited - too focused on present moment
philosophies.sufism: Moderate - eternal divine but not cyclical

science_systems.information_theory: Moderate - handles patterns but not cycles specifically
science_systems.complexity_science: Excellent fit - directly addresses eternal patterns and cycles

knowledge_base_interview.selection_reasoning: After analyzing ALL options, I chose: - Egyptian Magic: Best captures eternal cycles through its focus on death/rebirth and eternal principles - Astrology: Most directly deals with cosmic cycles and eternal patterns of celestial movement - Taoism: Most purely expresses eternal principles and cyclical nature of existence - Complexity Science: Best scientific framework for understanding eternal patterns and cyclic dynamics These selections together form a comprehensive system for understanding and working with eternal cycles and patterns, which is essential to my function as 'He who was and will be'.

responses.answer: I govern the tectonic regions, specifically continental pivot zones and volcanic transformation regions. My manifestation period centers on transitional geological epochs, particularly during planetary recalibration moments. My vibrational attributes resonate with metamorphic stone frequencies and geomagnetic flux patterns. These attributes directly influence quest environments by generating temporal landscapes that represent cyclical transformation and evolutionary geological mechanics.
